t: How Amazon’s big private-label business is growing and leaving small brands to protect against knockoffs
s: October 12, 2022 - Amazon continues to invest in private labels such as AmazonBasics, despite accusations that the company copies some of its top-selling third-party products.

t: All Your Favorite Brands, From BSTOEM to ZGGCD - The New York Times
s: February 11, 2020 - Brands like Pvendor, RIVMOUNT, FRETREE and MAJCF. Gloves emblazoned with names like Nertpow, SHSTFD, Joyoldelf, VBIGER and Bizzliz. Gloves with hundreds or even thousands of apparently positive reviews, available for very low prices, shipped quickly, for free, with Amazon Prime.

November 26, 2024 - Amazon Basics (formerly written as AmazonBasics) is a private label that offers home goods, office supplies, and tech accessories. The line was launched in 2009.
